title: Apple complains Meta requests risk privacy in spat over EU efforts to widen access to iPhone tech - The Hindu
summary:
Apple Complains Meta Requests Risk Privacy in Spat Over EU Efforts to Widen Access to iPhone Tech

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: The Hindu

Apple has raised concerns that Meta's requests for access to its operating software endanger user privacy, coinciding with the EU's push for interoperability among tech competitors.

  • The EU's Digital Markets Act aims to ensure fair competition in digital markets.
  • Apple claims Meta has made at least 15 requests for access that threaten user privacy.
  • If approved, Meta could gain extensive access to users' personal information.
  • Meta countered Apple's privacy claims, suggesting they are a cover for anti-competitive behavior.
  • The European Commission seeks public feedback on proposed interoperability guidelines by January 9.
‚ÄúIf those requests were granted, Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp could enable Meta to read on a user‚Äôs device all of their messages and emails, see every phone call they make or receive...‚Äù

The ongoing dispute highlights the tension between privacy measures and demands for interoperability in the tech industry.
newTitle: Apple Claims Meta Requests Threaten User Privacy Amid EU Interoperability Efforts

title: Windows 10 Support Ends In 2025, Should You Spend Big On A Windows AI Laptop? - News18
summary:
Windows 10 Support Ends In 2025, Should You Spend Big On A Windows AI Laptop?

Last Updated: December 20, 2024, 14:00 IST

With Microsoft ending support for Windows 10 in 2025, many users are facing the decision of whether to invest in a new AI-powered laptop. The current market offers new AI PCs promising advanced features, but potential buyers are advised to weigh their options carefully.

  • Support for Windows 10 will end in October 2025.
  • Windows 11 requires systems to support TPM 2.0 security technology for upgrades.
  • AI PCs are becoming prevalent, but they come at a premium price.
  • Qualcomm and Intel are introducing new AI hardware aimed at improving efficiency.
  • Investing in AI laptops may be worthwhile but waiting could bring better options in pricing and technology.
‚ÄúAI Windows laptops are potent but it is still early days to really talk highly about the AI nature of these machines.‚Äù

In conclusion, while AI-powered laptops present exciting advancements, consumers might benefit from patience as the market evolves with more affordable options post-2025.
newTitle: Windows 10 Support Ends In 2025: Is It Time to Invest in a Windows AI Laptop?

title: Sony now owns a much bigger piece of FromSoftware‚Äôs parent company - The Verge
summary:
Sony now owns a much bigger piece of FromSoftware‚Äôs parent company

Publication Date: November 20, 2024 Source: The Verge

Sony has expanded its investment in Kadokawa Corporation, acquiring shares worth 50 billion yen ($300 million), resulting in a total 10 percent ownership and solidifying Sony as Kadokawa's largest shareholder.

  • Sony announced the acquisition, increasing its share in Kadokawa to 10%.
  • The deal is valued at approximately 50 billion yen ($300 million).
  • Kadokawa is known for its significant holdings in media, including video game development with titles like Elden Ring.
  • A potential acquisition by Sony was previously rumored, which would integrate Kadokawa's vast IP portfolio with Sony's.
  • Sony and Kadokawa are set to discuss future collaborations for adaptation and production of Kadokawa IP.
‚ÄúDiscuss specific initiatives for collaboration‚Äù - Sony Press Release

This move indicates Sony's strategic intent to enhance its intellectual property portfolio, possibly paving the way for projects like a live-action adaptation of Elden Ring.
newTitle: Sony Increases Stake in FromSoftware's Parent Company Kadokawa

summary:

Date: Thursday
Source: Gadgets 360

Realme has unveiled the Realme 14 Pro 5G series, featuring a unique temperature-sensitive color-changing rear panel that alters its appearance when the temperature drops below 16 degrees Celsius.

  • The series comprises Realme 14 Pro and Realme 14 Pro+ models.
  • A temperature-sensitive back cover changes color from Pearl White to vibrant blue at low temperatures.
  • Co-created with Nordic design studio Valeur Designers, these models are claimed to be the first of their kind.
  • Scheduled for purchase starting January next year, featuring certifications for water and dust resistance (IP66, IP68, IP69).
  • Realme 14 Pro+ 5G has a triple rear camera system and a high screen-to-body ratio.
